intro: Silene aegyptiaca subsp. aegyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of North Africa. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are pink to purple in color, with five petals and a distinctive central spur. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
